body.p: The ACL (anterior cruciate ligament) is found in the knee and often needs repair in athletes. Which of the following functions do you think the ACL does?

multiple_choice.choice: connects the knee to the quadriceps (thigh muscle).
softens the impact at the ends of the leg bones in the knee

response.feedback: Correct. The ligaments stabilize articulations. With ACL injuries, the knee is unstable and can even separate!
Incorrect. This is the job of a tendon. Tendons connect bones to muscles and ligaments connect bone to bone and stabilize articulations.
Incorrect. That's the job of the cartilage. There are many examples of cartilage injury in the knee, but it is different than an ACL (ligament) tear.
Incorrect. The kneecap (or patella) is a bone.

part.hint: The ACL is a ligament; think about what ligaments do.

body.p: "Tennis elbow" is a condition wherein the outside of the elbow, as indicated above, is sore and tender from repeatedly using the muscle. Which parts of the skeletal system are most likely impacted?

response.feedback: Correct. Tendons connect bones to muscle and, in the case of the elbow, the tendon runs along the outside of the articulation.
Incorrect. Ligaments stabilize joints but are typically found inside the joint.
Incorrect. Often people have arthritis or other damage to the cartilage in the elbow, but cartilage damage is not associated with tennis elbow.
Incorrect. Bones come together at the elbow, but there is no damage to the bone with tennis elbow.

part.hint: "Outside the elbow" likely does not involve the articulation itself.
This is not a muscle injury, but does invlove the muscle.
